list_definition.definition: a quality very pleasing to the eye, ear etc
a woman or girl having such a quality

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was a great beauty in her youth.
His new car is a beauty!

list_ex_of_english: The beauties of 18th century architecture are limited to certain areas.
There is a feeling that because it is proletarian it must therefore contain some bidden beauties.
Let us see the beauties of our own country.
I believe they appreciate the beauties amongst which they live.
He said that this business of interfering with the beauties of the countryside by means of the overhead lines was kept to an irreducible minimum.
We want to do all we eau to make known the beauties of our own country, and to make our country attractive for other people.
One of the beauties of that approach is continuity.
I understand that it is customary to extol the virtues and beauties of one's constituency.
